comment: Very good and smooth but a little more peaty than I would prefer
If this would be the Nikka from the barrel, i would recommend it highly; looking over the Belgian coast it brought back sweet memories...
I guess I like the oily ones. And the bourbon-casked. This one is my favourite of the Nippon whiskies I've tried.
Absolutely beautiful. Hard to drink this one without smiling.
Good and close to great. Close.
Fantastic! Peaty, creamy, spicy and yummy. Define notes of toffee and coffee and smooth on the finish.
Amazing strong nose. Perfect level  of peatiness that isn't overwhelming.
A personal favourite this Japanese malt combines delicate salty peat with vanillaed toffee of the bourbon casks and fruity plums of sherry. Very well balanced, this is a real island malt...
pretty smooth, some hints of sweet toffey but also a good bit of smokeyness/peatyness

01/01/15 Nose is light and slightly fruity. No real smoky woody flavor. Very different than bourbon. Almost an astringint taste that may take me some getting used to. Better on the rock than neat. Floral comes through a bit but not sweet.
Hint of smoke and maple on the nose. Rich mouthfeel with a great savory/sweet finish - light peat, caramel, bit of spice. Delicious

This darker amber dram greeted me with a hint of peach and oak, both on fire. Going in, it was almost sherry, definitely smoky wood. Finished with a lingering caramel. Very, very smooth all around. A few drops of water seemed to add a bit of a spice. As a highball, it was rendered into an adult peach and apple drink (no judgment on that particular outcome...). To me, there was an odd (but NOT unpleasant) fleeting signature to the taste. I'm not sure what it is. It's unique.
Peaty and some vanilla. A great Japanese for the Islay lover. Not my bag.
The sweet taste of honey and fruits, with  smokey flavour always present in the background, truly makes this one of the most pleasant Japanese single malts.
This has to be one of my favorites. Incredibly smooth and silky--"oily" as many have mentioned before. That perfect amount of caramel sweetness and an unmistakeable smoke note. Rich and sublime.
Bought this in Japan last year for $60. Should have bought more bottles! Loved it and market prices in US have soared
45% Nose: sweet, oily, slight peat, dried fruit, hay, varnish, rich, carmelised sugar. Palate: oily, barley, peat. Water droplets brings out more oil and peat, smooth.
i love this whisky! i find it to be similar to the balvine style. very good!

This is a work of art. So good, so full bodied. I see it as a poor mans Highland Park 30 yr. or maybe what a Highland Park 30 would taste like after only 15 years.  It really benefits from a few drops of water.

Deliciously balanced; peat doesn't overrule the other flavors. The 20 year we tried at Genka Bar in Tokyo's Gotanda neighborhood was even better - a richer and more full bodied version of this. But for the price the 15 is no slouch.
Nice smooth peat notes with a subtle spicy and vanilla hint.
The one that started it all. Just as delicious as I remember, but more heavy on the smoke.
Rich, nutty and sweet and reminds me of the hibiki 17 - but a touch better. Adding a few drops makes it special.
Damn that's a dram! I effing love this whiskey, so many layers to unpack up front such a smooth almost nonexistAnt finish. Always say "one more."

Really rich and complex.  Yoichi is one of the only distilleries that still uses coal, so there's a very earthy flavor to this, in addition to the fruity sweet.  A real gem.  I've tried their 10 yr old and 15...the 10 has more fruit forward while the 15 is more earthy.  
Now that Nikka has announced they'll stop making age statements, I can't image the 15 to be in the market for long.  Wondering if Suntory will go that route too...getting noticeably harder to find the Yamazaki 18.
Very nice indeed. Just the right balance. Smoky but not peaty at all. Lots of depth to it. Shame it is so hard to find these days

On the nose: firm white fruit - pear, apple under ripe peach and vanila/amareto 
Finished malty
  Taste:white grape tartness, green apple, toffe/bunt sugar.
"10/2016 at Hook & Ladder with Charles Hsiao. Medium peat, balanced with nice sherry honey spicy."

Nose - Light peaty smoke, sweet salty brine, apples, honeydew melon.
Taste - Immediately a sweet briny smoke, light bitterness like that of an oversteeped black tea. Toasted wet seaweed, toasted oats and toasted malted barley.
Finish - Salty smoky seaweed, light bitterness like burnt wet seaweed, salted green tea caramel-like sweetness. Long lingering briny smoke. Light honeydew melon sweetness makes a background appearance.
80/100
Lightly peated but very smooth finish.

Amazing whisky. Was fortunate to order it at a restaurant that still has it and got one of the last pours of it there at $11. Amazing flavors of vanilla, caramel, coconut, floral notes, sherried berries, chocolate, nuttiness, a unique truffle earthiness, dried fruit, and whisps of smoke.
Intensely peaty very Dewars-esque but clean finish. Best paired with cheese.
One of the best all time whiskies out of Japan or anywhere for that matter.
definitely better than the 20 year old version. but both discontinued now and not worth the price point.
This whiskey reminds of BBQ ribs. Its smokiness is delicious, yet subtle.  A very balanced whiskey! I just hope Yoichi can keep making it!

Yeah, it's as good as they say it is. Know what's even better? Getting the last pour of it, probably ever, at your preferred local bar. The bartender gave me more like a pour and a half because there wasn't quite enough for a second...happy Father's Day to me! This has pretty much everything you could want in a Japanese whisky, or about any other kind - a nose that smells like a cookout in a fruit orchard at high season, a pleasantly rich (but not heavy) mouth with the right balance of ripe stone fruit, pineapple, and mango with charcoal smoke. The finish is lingering and smolders like those coals on the grill do long after you've finished cooking. So, so good - drink it if you can find it.
Nose is heavily sweet, notes of maple and fruit. Body has notes of fruit and vanilla, a bit of wood, peat, and smoke. A bit more depth than the 12 year.
